item.title: 美国职位空缺降至2020年以来最低水平，裁员人数小幅上升
item.description: 美国12月职位空缺意外降至2020年以来最低水平，同时裁员人数小幅上升，进一步印证劳动力需求疲软的态势。【原文：US job openings unexpectedly fell in December to the lowest level since 2020 and layoffs edged up, adding to evidence of sluggish demand for workers.】

item.title: 美股延续跌势，科技股暴跌已持续三日
item.description: 周四美国股市延续跌势，科技股走低，且私营部门就业数据重燃经济放缓担忧。【原文：US stocks continued to slide on Thursday as technology shares fell and private jobs data revived worries of an economic slowdown.】

item.title: 皇帝娱乐出售黄金储备获巨额收益
item.description: 帝皇娱乐酒店有限公司发现，黄金砖块的用途比装饰其澳门物业的豪华大堂更有利可图。【原文：Emperor Entertainment Hotel Ltd. found a more profitable use for gold bricks than decorating the sumptuous lobby of its Macau property.】

item.title: 津巴布韦寻求合作伙伴开发价值5亿美元的铂金矿
item.description: 津巴布韦国有企业穆塔帕铂金集团表示，已联系其他矿商协助开发该国一座价值5亿美元的矿山。【原文：Zimbabwe’s state-owned Mutapa Platinum Group said it has approached other miners to help it develop a $500 million mine in the country.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德将向欧盟领导人提交加强欧盟的清单
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜·拉加德承诺，将在即将召开的欧盟峰会上确保各国政府首脑审议一系列强化欧盟长期韧性的措施。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde vowed to ensure EU heads of government consider a whole list of measures to strengthen the bloc’s long-term resilience before their upcoming summit.】

item.title: 高盛为杜邦子公司交易筹备37.5亿美元债务发行
item.description: 高盛集团正筹备一项修订后的37.5亿美元融资方案——该方案现可能包含垃圾债券发行——以支持化工企业Arclin收购杜邦公司的芳纶业务。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is readying a revised $3.75 billion financing — now likely to include a junk bond offering — to support chemical maker Arclin Inc.’s acquisition of DuPont de Nemours Inc.’s Aramids business.】

item.title: 温克莱沃斯兄弟的Gemini将裁员25%，关闭欧洲业务
item.description: 加密货币交易所Gemini Space Station Inc.表示，计划裁减多达25%的员工，并逐步缩减在英国、欧盟和澳大利亚的业务，称此举旨在降低成本并提高盈利能力。【原文：Crypto exchange Gemini Space Station Inc. said it plans to cut up to 25% of its workforce and wind down operations in the UK, European Union and Australia, citing a strategy to reduce costs and improve profitability.】

item.title: South Korea Launches $3 Billion Sale of Dollar Bonds
item.description: South Korea is offering $3 billion of dollar bonds, in an effort to bolster its foreign exchange reserves amid global uncertainties and massive investments pledged under a US trade deal.

item.title: Vanguard CEO Ramji Poaches From Goldman, BlackRock for Key Roles
item.description: Vanguard Group Chief Executive Officer Salim Ramji is putting his imprint on the world’s second-largest asset manager by siphoning talent from Wall Street firms to fill key roles.

item.title: OpenAI Unveils Platform to Help Companies Deploy ‘AI Coworkers’
item.description: OpenAI is introducing a new platform that’s designed to help companies deploy AI agents more easily, part of a broader push to cement itself as a leader in automating valuable work tasks.The new product, called Frontier, allows organizations to build and manage these AI tools so that each agent has appropriate guardrails and data access. The goal is to simplify the process of rolling out AI agents — or “AI coworkers,” as OpenAI calls them — and pave the way for broader adoption of the technology

item.title: US Bonds Rally as Job-Market Angst Backs Wagers on Fed Rate Cuts
item.description: Treasuries rose after data showed a surge in job-cut announcements by US companies and a jump in claims for unemployment benefits, bolstering wagers that the Federal Reserve will resume cutting interest rates this year.

item.title: New York’s Pension Funds Scrutinize Palantir Over ICE Contract
item.description: New York’s pension funds are questioning Palantir Technologies Inc., a software company, over its business dealings with US Immigration and Customs Enforcement and the Department of Homeland Security.

item.title: Nigeria Central Bank Moves to Rein In Fintech, Boost Access to Capital
item.description: Nigeria is tightening scrutiny of its fast-growing fintech industry while easing licensing and improving access to capital as it tries to balance innovation with financial stability.

item.title: US Jobless Claims Top All Estimates in Week Hit by Extreme Cold
item.description: Applications for US unemployment benefits rose by more than forecast last week, when severe winter weather gripped much of the country.

item.title: 英格兰银行行长呼吁就曼德尔森爆料事件进行深刻反思
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁·贝利表示，彼得·曼德尔森与恋童癖金融家杰弗里·爱泼斯坦的关联令他"震惊"，并称社会必须对这些曝光事件进行深刻反思。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said he was “shocked” by Peter Mandelson’s ties with pedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein, adding that society must do some soul searching over the revelations.】

item.title: 初创公司Goodfire估值达12.5亿美元，致力于破解人工智能模型
item.description: 越来越多的市值数十亿美元的初创企业正竞相打造顶尖人工智能模型，这些模型能够接管软件工程师、音乐家和律师助理的工作。名为Goodfire的初创公司首席执行官埃里克·何认为，我们前进得太快了。【原文：A growing cadre of multibillion-dollar startups are racing to create the best artificial intelligence models, able to absorb tasks from software engineers, musicians and paralegals. Eric Ho, the chief executive officer of a startup called Goodfire, thinks we’re moving too fast.】

item.title: 微软罕见遭评级下调，Stifel警告Azure增长放缓
item.description: 微软公司遭遇了罕见的分析师评级下调，这再次表明，对软件公司的谨慎态度甚至蔓延到了某些最大、最具影响力的企业。【原文：Microsoft Corp. was hit with a rare analyst downgrade, in the latest sign of how caution toward software companies is even spreading to some of the biggest and most influential names.】

item.title: 欧洲央行维持利率不变，欧元走强与关税威胁经济
item.description: 欧洲央行维持利率不变，因官员们正在评估欧元升值和贸易局势再度动荡对经济造成的冲击。【原文：The European Central Bank kept interest rates unchanged as officials assess the economic toll of a rally in the euro and renewed trade unpredictability.】

item.title: 数据中心推动暖通空调市场增长，而家用空调销售却持续低迷
item.description: 随着人工智能应用的增长，数据中心热潮正成为制冷行业的重要增长引擎，这在一定程度上抵消了开利全球公司面向住宅客户的销售疲软，并推动江森自控国际公司的利润预期升至十年高位。【原文：A data center boom, driven by increased AI usage, is emerging as a key growth driver for cooling, helping offset Carrier Global Corp.’s soft sales to residential customers and lifting Johnson Controls International Plc’s profit outlook to a decade high.】

item.title: 欧洲对美俄液化天然气的依赖度攀升至80%以上创历史新高
item.description: 欧洲对两大液化天然气供应商的依赖度上月飙升至历史新高，引发外界担忧该地区仍未能实现供应多元化。【原文：Europe’s reliance on its two biggest providers of LNG surged to a record last month, stoking concern that the region is still failing to diversify.】

item.title: 沃伦要求贝森特终止与阿根廷200亿美元的互换额度
item.description: 参议员伊丽莎白·沃伦要求财政部长斯科特·贝森特终止与阿根廷的200亿美元货币互换安排，并表示若该协议已到期，就应予以终止。【原文：Senator Elizabeth Warren is requesting that Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent terminate a $20 billion currency swap line with Argentina, asserting that if the arrangement has run its course, it should be shut down.】

item.title: 马克龙计划在下周欧盟峰会上讨论欧元走强问题
item.description: 法国计划在下周欧盟领导人会议上讨论欧元兑美元汇率升值问题，此次会议旨在商讨如何提升欧盟整体疲软的竞争力。【原文：France intends to discuss the euro’s appreciation against the dollar when European Union leaders meet next week to discuss improving the bloc’s ailing competitiveness.】

item.title: 英国国债价格飙升，英镑汇率下跌，因英国央行投票结果助推市场押注三月降息
item.description: 英国基准债券扭转跌势，英镑汇率下跌，此前英国央行决策者意外接近降息，促使交易员押注进一步货币宽松政策。【原文：UK benchmark bonds reversed losses and the pound fell after Bank of England policymakers came unexpectedly close to cutting interest rates, prompting traders to bet on further monetary easing.】

item.title: 美国企业宣布裁员人数创2009年以来1月最高纪录
item.description: 根据职业安置公司Challenger, Gray & Christmas Inc.的数据，美国企业宣布的裁员数量创下自2009年大萧条最严重时期以来历年一月份的最高纪录。【原文：US companies announced the largest number of job cuts for any January since the depths of the Great Recession in 2009, according to data from outplacement firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas Inc.】

item.title: 比特币跌破7万美元关口，"强制去杠杆化"加速推进
item.description: 比特币周四跌破7万美元关口，加密货币市场整体跌势加剧，主要受边际需求消退、本周科技股及贵金属市场波动等因素影响。【原文：Bitcoin tumbled below $70,000 Thursday as negative momentum deepened across cryptocurrencies, driven by vanishing marginal demand and this week’s volatility in tech equities along with precious metals.】

item.title: 美国政府计划新建采矿公司开发非洲铜带矿区
item.description: 美国政府支持的一个团体计划入股嘉能可公司在刚果的铜矿业务，此举可能是创建一家美国公司以在非洲积累矿业资产的第一步。【原文：A US government-backed group’s plan to take stakes in Glencore Plc’s Congolese copper operations could be the first step in creating an American company to accumulate mining assets in Africa.】

item.title: 伦敦股市反弹，摩根大通与高盛淡化人工智能风险
item.description: 伦敦证券交易所集团股价从近五年最大两日跌幅中部分反弹，因摩根大通和高盛集团分析师淡化了人工智能对该公司数据与分析业务的影响。【原文：London Stock Exchange Group Plc shares partially rebounded from their biggest two-day drop in almost five years as analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. downplayed the impact of artificial intelligence on the firm’s data and analytics business.】

item.title: 无论特朗普如何宣称，印度都不太可能切断与俄罗斯的石油联系
item.description: 新德里对是否将在与美国达成贸易协议后停止与莫斯科的石油贸易保持沉默。【原文：New Delhi remains silent on whether it will cease oil trade with Moscow after US trade deal.】

item.title: 中国释放GDP增速目标下调信号，刺激力度或将减弱
item.description: 北京方面被认为正在下调经济增长目标，此举可能降低对刺激措施的需求。【原文：Beijing is seen lowering its economic growth target in a move that may reduce the need for stimulus.】

item.title: Peloton大幅下调销售预期，尽管推出新硬件仍未达预期
item.description: Peloton Interactive Inc.股价下跌，此前该公司给出的第三财季营收预期低于市场预期，令投资者失望。这些投资者曾希望近期硬件升级能推动公司实现长期承诺的业务转机。【原文：Shares of Peloton Interactive Inc. fell after the company provided a weaker-than-expected revenue forecast for the fiscal third quarter, disappointing investors who hoped a recent hardware revamp would spur a long-promised turnaround.】
